@austincwb @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Argghh. This is exactly what we should not do. We need to slow the flow to stop upland rain ending up in downstream shops, offices and homes. So - keep those gullies clogged up, reduce the flood peak and avoid misery to hundreds of homeowners and businesses.
@JonKiddd @EnvAgencyNW @K_Fletcher_MP Of course! We have made some tweaks to the automated operations and so our folk are they to make sure all ok (which it is) #beprepared

@suesustainable @olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils Why need courts when Civil Sanctions could be used to levy heavy fines for such activities. Waste disposal is a crime for every other industry.

@AndreasHeinem @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Yes we do - EMBER project that @UniversityLeeds ran through @wateratleeds for example. Saturated peatlands have rougher surfaces that slow down flow. (And its not just peatland burning that is an issue - we burn heaths, grasses etc.)
